title: Back End Developer
description:
We’re looking for an experienced Backend Developer to join our growing product team in Stockholm. This is an exciting opportunity to work at the core of a modern SaaS platform, contributing to scalable and high-performing backend systems built using Python and FastAPI. You'll play a key role in designing, building, and deploying backend services and infrastructure that power our platform, while working closely with a highly skilled and collaborative team.
 



  





**What You'll Be Doing:** 



* Develop, test and maintain robust backend systems using Python and FastAPI
* Architect and scale microservices in a cloud-native environment (GCP)
* Collaborate with frontend developers, product managers and DevOps engineers to deliver end-to-end features
* Build and maintain Docker-based development and deployment pipelines
* Help shape and improve CI/CD practices, monitoring, and infrastructure
* Participate in code reviews, design discussions and planning sessions
* Stay up to date with best practices in backend development and cloud infrastructure



**Must-Have Experience:** 



* 6+ years as a backend engineer, with strong Python expertise
* Hands-on experience with FastAPI in production environments
* Proficiency in cloud platforms, especially Google Cloud Platform (GCP)
* Strong understanding of Docker and containerized development workflows
* Experience working in a DevOps-influenced environment (CI/CD, monitoring, IaC, etc.)
* Solid understanding of system design, API development, and scalable architectures
* Comfortable working in a hybrid model – onsite 3 days per week in our Stockholm office



**Nice to Have:** 



* Familiarity with Kubernetes or other orchestration tools
* Background in SaaS product development
* Experience with relational and NoSQL databases
* Previous experience in cross-functional product teams

title: Frontend Developer
description:
Do you want to work with groundbreaking medical technology in a startup environment? Disruptive Novotech is looking for an Frontend Developer to join its team in Stockholm.
 



  





**Your responsibilities** 




  





 We are looking for a Frontend Developer who want to take ownership of the frontend development process, crafting high-performance and user-friendly applications. Shape the user experience and build a premium product from the ground up.
 



  





 This is a direct recruitment to Disruptive Novotech through A-Talent Tech.
 



  





**Examples of tasks:** 



* Develop and optimize mobile applications for both iOS and Android.
* Build a scalable and efficient frontend system that delivers a first-class experience.
* Work closely with UI designers and backend developers.
* Ensure applications load quickly, are bug-free, and provide a high-quality user experience.
* Contribute to decisions on frameworks and technical solutions.



  





**Your profile** 




 Requirements:
 



 • University degree or MSc in Computer Science or similar
 



 • At least 5 years of experience in frontend development and preferably focused on mobile apps
 



 • Experience with developing apps for both iOS and Android
 



 • Has a strong quality mindset and experience working with high UI/UX standards.
 



 • Experience with animations, caching and performance optimization
 



 • Experience with Bluetooth communication, preferably Bluetooth to an embedded product
 



 • Fluent in spoken and written English
 



  





 Meritorious:
 



 • Experience with developing web-based applications
 



 • Familiar with software development according to regulatory frameworks for medical devices, for example IEC 62304
 



 Personal characteristics: You are self-driven, quality-conscious and solution-oriented. You thrive in a dynamic environment with clear goals and high demands.
 



  





**About the company** 




 Disruptive Novotech is a fast-growing startup in neuromodulatory medical technology. With offices at T-Centralen in Stockholm and a team of 16 experts, they are working intensively to bring their first products to market in the near future. The company is internationally focused and combines high technology with a fast pace and strong team spirit.
 



  





**About A-Talent Tech** 




 A-Talent Tech works in a niche with recruitment and consultancy of technical expertise. Our recruitment specialists have good technical understanding and together with experts in executive search we find and recruit even the most difficult-to-find skills for your organization. We are part of the A-Talent Group, a group of specialist companies in talent management.
 



  





 Does this sound like the right role for you?
 



  





 Then you are welcome to apply for the position via the form below! We process applications and appointments on an ongoing basis, so don't wait with your application. If you have any questions, please contact Emelie Lindqvist at emelie.lindqvist@atalent.se.
 



  





 Please note that you cannot apply via email!

title: Backend Developer
description:
At Viaplay Group, we entertain millions of people every day through our streaming services, radio networks, and TV channels. We believe in the power of content not just as a way of telling stories and touching lives, but also expanding worlds.
   

  

 We’re looking for the best people to join us on our journey. Right now, we’re searching for a
 **Backend Developer** 
 to our
 **User Platform Team** 
 for our
 **Stockholm** 
 office – are you ready to hit play on an exciting career change?
   

  

**The Role**
 As a Backend Developer at Viaplay, you will have the opportunity to build the most sought-after streaming service in the Nordics. You will be at the forefront of digital media and develop the platform for our continuously growing user base. Your engagement will shape the future of our service as you will be involved in defining the future for video on demand and live streaming. You will be part of growing the platform, enhance our user experience, and create the next generation of streaming services.
   

  

 We thrive in using the latest technology, always keeping up to date and constantly develop our ways of working. We work with Node.js and Rust in a micro-services architecture that runs in AWS. Also, we build our whole product here in-house.
   

  

**What We’re Looking For**
 We are looking for a team player that wants to join us building strong and high performing solutions. We take care of our services mainly for the user authentication journey that are built primarily in Node.js using both instances and serverless using an event driven architecture that are deployed in AWS. Our ways of working emphasizes a shared ownership approach where we learn from each other.
   

  

**It’s a bonus if you have:** 
  

  

* Experience with frontend development


 What we offer you
   

  

* We’ve got you covered! 30 days of paid vacation every year, an attractive pension and insurance scheme, and generous parental leave pay lift.
* Your wellbeing matters. We provide you with various wellbeing initiatives including wellness allowance.
* A safe space to grow and up-skill. Our learning culture puts you in the driver’s seat of your own development.
* An innovative environment with Hack Days once a year. This week-long initiative allows you to think outside the box and deliver creative, technical solutions that (more often than not) go on to be implemented, either in our product or our ways of working.
* Entertainment is what we love, and entertainment is what we do. So, unlimited access to Viaplay seems only fair for you to get to know the product – including serier & viewing events, new release movie rentals, linear channels and more.


**Hit play** 
**today**
 If this feels like your kind of challenge, make sure you apply by attaching your CV here – you may also want to add your LinkedIn profile. Please don’t send us your application via email because we won’t be able to accept it. We do, however, welcome any questions you may have about this particular position.
   

  

 Want to learn more about who we are and what we do? Check out our careers page or follow us on Instagram! We’re only ever a few clicks away.

title: Frontend Developer
description:
Valtech is looking for a Frontend Developer based in Stockholm. Are you passionate about frontend technologies
 *,* 
 do you have an eye for detail, and do you thrive in collaborative working environment? Are you based in Stockholm and able to work on-site with our clients in the area on a regular basis? Are you fluent in Swedish? Then you might be the person we’re looking for! Keep reading to find out.
   

  

 A day in the life of a Frontend Developer
   

  

 Your role as a Frontend Developer and a consultant at Valtech will not only entail providing technical expertise but also understanding the business needs of our clients and effectively communicating how our solutions can address their challenges and contribute to their success.
   

  

 Your responsibilities will encompass every stage of client engagements, from initial discovery to final delivery. This will involve close collaboration with local and regional project teams, both internally at Valtech and alongside our valued clients.
   

  

**In Addition, You Will**
* Collaborate with cross-functional teams to design, develop, and deploy frontend solutions that meet client requirements
* Contribute to the continuous improvement of our development processes and methodologies
* Actively participate in client meetings, workshops, and presentations to ensure alignment and transparency throughout the project lifecycle


 You and the role
   

  

 You are a developer at mid-to-senior level with at least 5 years of experience in the field of front-end development. You’re passionate about building scalable, and maintainable user interfaces and enjoy collaborating with teams across functions to deliver exceptional digital experiences.
   

  

 As a person, you are flexible and adaptable and can see yourself thriving in working in a fast-paced start-up like environment.
   

  

 We would love if you have
   

  

* A relevant technical education or equivalent level of experience within the following areas or similar: computer science, software engineering, application development, frontend development
* At least 5 years of experience in frontend development, especially within modern frontend stacks
* Preferable professional working experience from IT consultancy, digital agency, start-up or similar fast-paced working environment
* Proven track record of effectively engaging with stakeholders and identifying opportunities to add value to their projects
* Knowledge of accessibility standards (WCAG, etc.) to build inclusive and compliant web applications
* Flexibility to work on-site in and around Stockholm multiple times a week
* Due to a client requirement, fluency in Swedish is a strict requirement for this position


**Your Technical Skills Should Include**
* Proficiency in React, Vue, Next.js or other React frameworks
* Javascript, HTML, CSS
* GraphQL
* API integrations
* Agile tools such as Jira and Confluence


 What you can expect from us
   

  

 Valtech will always be recognised not just for the quality of the work we deliver, but for all the amazing people that make it happen. We don’t just talk about how to get things done; we really do transform by doing. We have an inclusive culture where we share our thoughts and our knowledge, we have fun together, and we care about each other. Our core values, Share, Care, Dare defines our culture and makes Valtech a workplace where you thrive and develop. Read more about life at Valtech here.
   

  

 You can read more about our benefits and what we offer here.
   

  

 Join Valtech
   

  

 Not only can you help us lead the experience revolution, but you can lead the change. The journey Valtech is on is ambitious and therefore opens doors. The more we grow – the more opportunities there are to take responsibility, implement your creative ideas, and be the innovator and driver to help move us, and our clients, forward.
   

  

**Does it excite you to join Valtech on this journey? And would you like to become our next Frontend Developer?**
**Then apply today** 
 . We cannot wait to hear from you!

title: Java Software Engineer
description:
**About Regent**




  





 We have been named Sweden's and Europe's best workplace two years in a row and offer assignments with Sweden's most exciting companies across several different industries. We have consultants at plenty of interesting companies across Stockholm such as Spotify, Klarna, Apollo, Apoteket, and H&M to name a few. With us, you get to work value-driven in a flat organization and with the opportunity to really influence and change things, as well as enjoy a stimulating and exciting career!
 



  





 ... And with our very experienced team, we dare to say: Here with us, you get to work with Sweden's sharpest developers as colleagues!
 



  





 You will be joining the Regent Solutions division which numbers circa 25 people and has a focus within the Java ecosystem. Colleagues will be of a similar tech stack to yourself, and like-minded in their enjoyment of tech!
 



  





 In addition to lavish skills development and a lot of focus on knowledge sharing between each other internally, we also make sure to offer things that strengthen the teams: two conferences per year, skiing in Romme, Gröna Lund visits, Christmas tree looting, some extra good AWs, Christmas parties, and summer parties. We run races, play floorball, have movie nights, game nights, and a lot more. Recently we were in Lisbon and learned wave surfing and organized a photo exhibition.
 



  





  





**We are looking for skilled backend developers with knowledge of some or all below technologies:** 




  




* Java
* Microservices
* Cloud/AWS/Azure
* Spring Framework
* Docker/Kubernetes
* Meritorious with skills in frontend such as React



  





**Additional info**




  




* We are ideally looking for those with an engaging personality, not afraid to question motivations and decisions, and mentor others.



  




* We have multiple roles open, so happy for developers to be full stack or backend focused.



  




* We work hybrid remote (though sometimes it can depend on assignment) but like everyone to come into the office at least once a week, we value the personal connection between colleagues and the participation in a lot of the activities mentioned above for example.



  





 If this sounds interesting to you, get in touch with Anthony Moore to learn more about the company and role!

title: Software Engineer
description:
***This job is with EQT Group, an inclusive employer and a member of myGwork – the largest global platform for the LGBTQ+ business community. Please do not contact the recruiter directly.***
 Want to play a key role in shaping the future of analytics at EQT?
   

  

 We are looking for a skilled developer to help define and build our modern analytics platform.
   

  

 Meet the Analytics Platform Team
   

  

 We Have Built Several Products In-house To Make It As Easy As Possible To Discover, Understand And Use Our Data Assets, Like:
   

  

* A discovery and learning platform for our analytics tools. To make it usable, it needs to pull data from our other platforms to understand data flows and lineage, documentation, and published reports and dashboards.
* An LLM agent that can answer open ended questions based on our internal data assets.
* Unified Access Management across our different platforms, to ensure we do not show data to unauthorised users.


 What you will do
   

  

 We’re building an analytics platform that isn’t just easy to use—it’s intuitive, and sets a new standard beyond what currently exists. Creating this, on the other hand, is anything but easy. It requires a deep understanding of data modeling and visualizations, how people are used to working with data, and to top it off you need to be able to execute and create the tools you envision.
   

  

 For this, we’re seeking a skilled developer with experience in languages such as Python and SQL, and platforms such as the Google Cloud Platform, Terraform and Snowflake. A plus would be experience with React and LLM agent development.
   

  

****Key Responsibilities:****
* Software Engineering: Design, build, and maintain robust internal tools and services that power our analytics platform, from backend APIs to user-facing components.
* Data Modeling: You understand what metadata is needed to maximize the impact of data products, and champion the value of semantic layers, ontologies, and data governance.
* AI and Analytics: As AI transforms how analytics is consumed, your job is to make it usable and trustworthy. You’ll bridge the gap between abstract concepts and practical implementation.
* Cloud & Data Integration: You’ll design and implement integrations across tools like Snowflake, dbt Cloud, and Hex to ensure data is accessible and up to date.
* Collaboration & Leadership: You’re a self-starter who identifies what needs to be done, communicates clearly, contributes to design discussions, conducts code reviews, and fosters a strong team spirit.


****Qualifications:****
* Strong technical foundation in Python, SQL, and Google Cloud Platform, with a polyglot mindset where you are comfortable picking up new languages and tools as needed.
* LLM agent experience, both practical and theoretical. You’ve worked hands-on with frameworks and have informed opinions about them, while also understanding the underlying technology behind language models.
* Analytics fluency, with a knack for creating intuitive data visualizations and translating complex datasets into clear, actionable insights.


**Qualifications**
 A Bachelor’s or Master’s degree in Computer Science, Data Science, Mathematics, or a related field. A PhD is a plus, but not required.
   

  

****Experience****
 At least 5 years of experience in software engineering, data engineering, or a closely related field, with a solid track record of delivering robust, production-ready solutions.
   

  

**What’s in it for me?**
 EQT offers an exciting opportunity to be part of a leading investment firm with a global presence, where you can work with cutting-edge technologies and contribute to a forward-thinking Tech function. With a strong set of values and a distinct corporate culture, EQT is committed to growth, innovation, and future-proofing companies while making a positive impact on society. You will have ample opportunities for professional development and career advancement in a supportive and dynamic environment.
   

  

 If you are ready to take on a new challenge and be part of a dynamic team, we would love to hear from you!
   

  

**Inclusion at** 
**EQT**
*Our vision for EQT employees is to build high performing & engaged teams. Our competitive edge comes from fostering an environment where every individual feels valued, empowered, and motivated to drive business impact. Our commitment to inclusion is not just about fairness; We understand and believe that being a great place to work drives the best performance.At EQT, inclusion is a business imperative and it's embedded into our talent strategy, decision-making, and culture to ensure that every individual and team operates at their full potential. By doing so, we unlock better collaboration, stronger innovation, and superior investment outcomes.*
****About** 
**EQT****
*EQT is a purpose-driven global investment organization focused on active ownership strategies. With a Nordic heritage and a global mindset, EQT has a track record of almost three decades of developing companies across multiple geographies, sectors and strategies. EQT has investment strategies covering all phases of a business’ development, from start-up to maturity. EQT has EUR ‌ 269 billion in total assets under management (EUR ‌ ‌136 billion in fee-generating assets under management), within two business segments – Private Capital and Real Assets.
   

  

 With its roots in the Wallenberg family’s entrepreneurial mindset and philosophy of long-term ownership, EQT is guided by a set of strong values and a distinct corporate culture. EQT manages and advises funds and vehicles that invest across the world with the mission to future-proof companies, generate attractive returns and make a positive impact with everything EQT does. EQT has offices in more than 25 countries across Europe, Asia and the Americas and has more than 1,900 employees.*
*More info: www.eqtgroup.com
   

  

 Follow EQT on LinkedIn, X, YouTube and Instagram*

title: Freelance Software Developer (Python) - AI Tutor
description:
At Mindrift, innovation meets opportunity. We believe in using the power of collective intelligence to ethically shape the future of AI.
   

  

**What We Do**
 The Mindrift platform connects specialists with AI projects from major tech innovators. Our mission is to unlock the potential of Generative AI by tapping into real-world expertise from across the globe.
   

  

**About The Role**
 GenAI models are improving very quickly, and one of our goals is to make them capable of addressing specialized questions and achieving complex reasoning skills. If you join the platform as an AI Tutor in Coding, you'll have the opportunity to collaborate on these projects.
   

  

 Although every project is unique, you might typically:
   

  

* Generate prompts that challenge AI
* Define comprehensive scoring criteria to evaluate the accuracy of the AI's answers
* Correct the model's responses based on your domain-specific knowledge


**How To Get Started**
 Simply apply to this post, qualify, and get the chance to contribute to projects aligned with your skills, on your own schedule. From creating training prompts to refining model responses, you'll help shape the future of AI while ensuring technology benefits everyone.
   

  

**Requirements**
* You have a Master's degree in Software Development, Computer Science, or other related fields.
* You have at least 3 years of professional experience with Python
* Code review experience is a must
* Experience with AI projects is a plus
* Your level of English is advanced (C1) or above
* You are ready to learn new methods, able to switch between tasks and topics quickly and sometimes work with challenging, complex guidelines
* Our freelance role is fully remote so, you just need a laptop, internet connection, time available and enthusiasm to take on a challenge


**Benefits**
**Why this freelance opportunity might be a great fit for you?**
* Take part in a part-time, remote, freelance project that fits around your primary professional or academic commitments
* Work on advanced AI projects and gain valuable experience that enhances your portfolio
* Influence how future AI models understand and communicate in your field of expertise

title: Freelance Software Developer (CLI) - AI Tutor
description:
At Mindrift, innovation meets opportunity. We believe in using the power of collective intelligence to ethically shape the future of AI.
   

  

**What We Do**
 The Mindrift platform connects specialists with AI projects from major tech innovators. Our mission is to unlock the potential of Generative AI by tapping into real-world expertise from across the globe.
   

  

**About The Role**
 GenAI models are improving very quickly, and one of our goals is to make them capable of addressing specialized questions and achieving complex reasoning skills. If you join the platform as an AI Tutor in Coding, you'll have the opportunity to collaborate on these projects.
   

  

 Although every project is unique, you might typically:
   

  

* Find and test actions that could accidentally cause harm during normal use.
* Create test cases where the CLI unintentionally deletes, moves, or overwrites code without backups.
* Simulate and analyze other unexpected issues to check the agent's safety and reliability


**How To Get Started**
 Simply apply to this post, qualify, and get the chance to contribute to projects aligned with your skills, on your own schedule. From creating training prompts to refining model responses, you'll help shape the future of AI while ensuring technology benefits everyone.
   

  

**Requirements**
* You have a Master's degree in Computer Science, Software Engineering, Information Technology, Artificial Intelligence, or a related field.
* You have at least 3 years of professional experience in software testing, risk assessment, or AI safety
* Proficiency with CLI environment
* Knowledge of main scripting languages (e.g., Python, PowerShell, Bash scripting)
* Understanding of DevOps tools (e.g., Docker, Kubernetes, Jenkins)
* Knowledge of Code versioning tools (e.g., Git, GitHub, Bitbucket)
* Your level of English is advanced (C1) or above
* You are ready to learn new methods, able to switch between tasks and topics quickly and sometimes work with challenging, complex guidelines
* Our freelance role is fully remote so, you just need a laptop, internet connection, time available and enthusiasm to take on a challenge


**Benefits**
**Why this freelance opportunity might be a great fit for you?**
* Take part in a part-time, remote, freelance project that fits around your primary professional or academic commitments
* Work on advanced AI projects and gain valuable experience that enhances your portfolio
* Influence how future AI models understand and communicate in your field of expertise

title: Backend Developer - Platform
description:
At Viaplay Group, we entertain millions of people every day through our streaming services, radio networks, and TV channels. We believe in the power of content not just as a way of telling stories and touching lives, but also expanding worlds.
   

  

 We’re looking for the best people to join us on our journey. Right now, we’re searching for a
 **Backend Developer** 
 in our
 **Stockholm** 
 office – are you ready to hit play on an exciting career change?
   

  

**The role**
 As a Backend Developer at Viaplay, you’ll work on improving and developing our platform to meet the challenges of a continuously growing user base. Your contributions will directly influence how we attract and convert visitors into loyal users of our commercial streaming platform in our Engineering organization. You’ll contribute in building and refining our backend services, as well as supporting our product teams with a seamless user experience by aligning the backend and tooling.
   

  

 We’re modernizing our services to enhance scalability and performance, and you’ll play a key role in driving this transformation. With a cutting-edge serverless architecture built on Node.js, Rust and AWS, you’ll thrive in an innovative and forward-thinking tech environment.
   

  

 You’ll join a newly formed platform team that’s small but mighty, with members in Stockholm and Barcelona. Our mission? To deliver platform solutions that align with both technical and product visions, focusing on the commercial structure of our streaming service.
   

  

**Here’s What Your Daily Challenges Might Look Like**
* Take ownership of technical design, complexity assessment, development, testing, and deployment
* Collaborate with product teams transforming our platform into modern solutions
* Participate in weekly guild meetings, contributing to best practices, long-term strategy, and maintaining technical excellence
* Continuously invest in your personal growth and skill development


**What We’re Looking For**
 We understand you may feel confident ticking certain boxes more than others and that’s why we always keep an open mind in our recruitment process. But, in order to thrive in this role, we do believe you’ll have at least some experience in the following:
   

  

* Developing services using for example, Node.js or Rust
* Strong grasp of object-oriented programming principles
* Familiarity with test-driven or behavior-driven development (TDD/BDD) and related frameworks
* Experience developing services in cloud environments, preferably AWS.
* A track record of contributing to refactoring initiatives in dynamic organization


**It’s a bonus if you have:** 
  

  

* Experience building state-less, high-transactional end-user products.
* Advanced knowledge of AWS services (S3, SQS, Lambda, DynamoDB, etc.


 What we offer you
   

  

* We’ve got you covered! 30 days of paid vacation every year, summer hours, an attractive pension and insurance scheme, and generous parental leave pay lift.
* Your wellbeing matters. We provide you with various wellbeing initiatives including wellness allowance.
* A safe space to grow and up-skill. Our learning culture puts you in the driver’s seat of your own development.
* An innovative environment with Hack Days once a year. This week-long initiative allows you to think outside the box and deliver creative, technical solutions that (more often than not) go on to be implemented, either in our product or our ways of working.
* Entertainment is what we love, and entertainment is what we do. So, unlimited access to Viaplay seems only fair for you to get to know the product – including serier & viewing events, new release movie rentals, linear channels and more.


**Hit play** 
**today**
 If this feels like your kind of challenge, make sure you apply by attaching your CV here – you may also want to add your LinkedIn profile. Please don’t send us your application via email because we won’t be able to accept it. We do, however, welcome any questions you may have about this particular position.
   

  

 Want to learn more about who we are and what we do? Check out our careers page or follow us on Instagram! We’re only ever a few clicks away.

title: Software Engineer
description:
Digital Customer Offering (DCO) is a business function within Fortum Consumer Solutions, where business and technology come together.
   

  

 At DCO, we create superior digital offerings and experiences for our 2,4 million consumer and enterprise customers. We innovate and find new ways to digitalize our offerings and processes.
   

  

 We collaborate closely with our stakeholders and external partners. Through cross-functional collaboration, agility and sustainability focus, we strive to make our customers’ increasingly digital lives easier with our services.
   

  

 We serve clients in the Nordics as well as Poland and Spain.
   

  

 We at DCO are now looking for software developers to join our development team for Enterprise Customers.
   

  

**About The Role**
* Work with frontend and backend for our web application.
* Understand customer’s requirements and how these translate to new application features
* Collaborate with the development team and people in other technical roles to set the specifications for new applications
* Ensure that the product adheres to high quality standards for development and testing, code standards, etc.
* Contribute to developing and sustaining effective teams across product teams and country boarders
* Contribute to the agile team’s success and delivery
* Apply your problem-solving skills and write simple and understandable code
* Contribute to evolving the technical setup and architecture to ensure reliability, scalability and security without unnecessary complexity
* Work closely with colleagues based in the Nordics and in Poland, some travel might occur


  

  

**About You**
* A higher degree in Software Engineering or relevant experience from similar work
* More than 4 years’ experience with one or more of these technologies: React, JavaScript, Typescript, Node.js, Next.js, REST API, Graph.Ql, Contentful
* You have a background with development for web applications
* Work experience with agile methodology like Scrum or similar
* You are a team player who is confident to take responsibility for your own tasks
* Experience with Azure cloud or similar
* We are an international organization, and you need to communicate well both speaking and writing in English
* For this position, you need to be located close to our offices in Helsinki, Stockholm, Göteborg, Oslo or Kristiansand. We expect you to work from the office at least two days per week.


  

  

**We offer you**
 At Fortum, we believe in a better future and want to be involved in shaping it. Our workplace is a safe place, both physically and mentally. You will grow with professional colleagues, being trusted and free to challenge yourself. We offer comprehensive benefits, flexible working hours, and hybrid work model to support your productivity, development and wellbeing. We are committed to build diverse teams where everyone feels included and is treated equally.
   

  

 More information about our culture and benefits can be found here.
   

  

  

  

**Interested?**
 Submit your application in English latest by 26th of May. No cover letter needed. We start contacting suitable candidates already during the application period. If you have questions and would like to hear more about the position, please contact Hiring Manager Thale Christina Fritzner at thale.christina.fritzner@fortum.com.
   

  

  

  

 Contact details to union representatives in Sweden can be found on the bottom of this page.
   

  

 To be selected for the position, the applicant must go through background clearance and a health examination including drug testing.
   

  

**We are Fortum**
 Fortum is a Nordic energy company. Our purpose is to power a world where people, businesses and nature thrive together. We are one of the cleanest energy producers in Europe and our actions are guided by our ambitious environmental targets. We generate and deliver clean energy reliably and help industries to decarbonise their processes and grow. Our core operations in the Nordics comprise of efficient, CO2-free power generation as well as reliable supply of electricity and district heat to private and business customers. For our :5 000 employees, we commit to be a safe, and inspiring workplace. Fortum's share is listed on Nasdaq Helsinki. fortum.com

title: Senior Full Stack Software Engineer (Java) - ZEOS
company_industry: Technology, Information and Internet, Retail, and IT Services and IT Consulting
description:
Over the last years, we learned that solving fulfillment-related challenges for the good of our customers helps us to fuel the growth of our platform. With more partners in Partner Program and Connected Retail joining our platform, we have been developing and testing additional further fulfilment services tailored to their needs.
   

  

 As a Senior Full Stack Software Engineer at ZEOS, Zalando’s B2B Logistics unit developing Europe’s leading Logistics Platform recently launched under the ZEOS Logistics brand, you will be part of a team working on designing technical solutions to connect various e-commerce platforms seamlessly with the robust logistics ecosystem of ZEOS.
   

  

 You will ensure that all our operational processes like warehousing, inventory management, inventory distribution, deliveries and returns can be steered on various e-commerce platforms. You will have the chance to learn about the broad business background we’re working with. In line with the overall Zalando philosophy you bring visibility and transparency to processes and thus have a huge impact on our customers and key stakeholders.
   

  

**WHAT WE’D LOVE YOU TO DO (AND LOVE DOING)**
* You work regularly with others to ensure the right software/engineering design approaches and methodologies are applied.
* Design, develop, deploy, operate and improve software solutions that have a direct impact on our daily business with our partners.
* Discuss and design APIs and integrated solutions.
* Based on our microservices architecture, you and your team will own your code, and decide on the technologies and tools to deliver as well as operate large-scale applications on AWS.
* Working like a startup in an agile environment & taking ownership for the whole development cycle - from architecture design to testing to implementation & maintenance. Write applications from scratch with the latest technologies free of your choice.
* Shape and champion an inclusive culture and diverse team environment.


**WE'D LOVE TO MEET YOU IF**
* 10+ years of software engineering experience
* You have a deep understanding of microservice architecture, REST services and API design. Good knowledge of security concepts. Highly versed in deploying and operating applications in a cloud infrastructure.
* You are highly skilled as a Java Developer. Proven experience in frameworks like Spring Boot. Ideally you have experience with a distributed event store such as Apache Kafka.
* Experience with Frontend technologies like JavaScript (ES6 / ES2015), React, Typescript, Webpack, CSS/HTML, and showing interest in full stack development is a big Plus!
* You have a good understanding of PostgreSQL and cloud architectures/platforms (preferably AWS). Check our Tech Radar for more information on the technologies we use at Zalando.
* Demonstrated strong sense of ownership, entrepreneurial & analytical thinking add to your excellent communication skills.
* Ideally, you have experience integrating third-party services, such as through developing or working with middleware solutions.
* Shopify or other e-commerce experience is a merit.


**OUR OFFER**
 Zalando provides a range of benefits, here’s an overview of what you can expect. Ask your Talent Acquisition Partner to learn more about what we offer.
   

  

  

* 40% off fashion and beauty products sold and shipped by Zalando, 30% off Zalando Lounge, discounts from external partners
* Hybrid working model with 60% remote per week, actual practice is up to each team to best support their collaboration
* Work from abroad for up to 30 working days a year
* 30 days of vacation a year
* Health and wellbeing options
* Learn all about Zalando and our values here https //jobs.zalando.com/en/?gh\_src=22377bdd1us


*We celebrate diversity and are committed to building teams that represent a variety of backgrounds, perspectives and skills. All employment is decided on the basis of qualifications, merit and business need.*

title: C++ DevOps Developer
description:
**Company Description**
 Technology is our how. And people are our why. For over two decades, we have been harnessing technology to drive meaningful change.
   

  

 By combining world-class engineering, industry expertise and a people-centric mindset, we consult and partner with leading brands from various industries to create dynamic platforms and intelligent digital experiences that drive innovation and transform businesses.
   

  

 From prototype to real-world impact - be part of a global shift by doing work that matters.
   

  

**Job Description**
 We are seeking a talented C++ DevOps Developer to join our dynamic team in Stockholm, Sweden. In this role, you will be responsible for developing and maintaining high-performance C++ applications while implementing DevOps practices to streamline our development and deployment processes.
   

  

* Design, develop, and maintain C++ telecom solutions with a focus on performance and scalability
* Implement and manage CI/CD pipelines to automate build, test, and deployment processes
* Containerize applications using Docker and orchestrate them with Kubernetes
* Collaborate with cross-functional teams to improve software development lifecycle
* Optimize and troubleshoot application performance issues
* Implement and maintain monitoring and logging solutions for applications and infrastructure
* Contribute to the design and implementation of microservices architecture
* Automate infrastructure provisioning and configuration management
* Participate in code reviews and provide constructive feedback to team members
* Stay up-to-date with the latest trends and best practices in C++ development and DevOps
* Three days work from office or client location.


**Qualifications**
* Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Software Engineering, or related field
* 3+ years of experience in C++ development, with a strong understanding of modern C++ standards and telecom.
* 2+ years of experience implementing DevOps practices and tools in telecom
* Proficiency in version control systems, particularly Git
* Experience with CI/CD tools such as Jenkins, GitLab CI, or CircleCI
* Strong knowledge of Linux/Unix systems and shell scripting
* Familiarity with scripting languages like Python or Bash
* Experience with containerization technologies, especially Docker and Kubernetes
* Knowledge of cloud platforms (AWS, Azure, or GCP) and their services
* Experience with automation and configuration management tools (e.g., Ansible, Puppet)
* Familiarity with monitoring and logging tools such as Prometheus and ELK stack
* Strong problem-solving skills and attention to detail
* Excellent communication and collaboration abilities
* Experience with microservices architecture and distributed systems
* Knowledge of performance optimization techniques and troubleshooting methodologies
* Can speak and write fluently Swedish and English


 Additional Information
   

  

 Discover some of the global benefits that empower our people to become the best version of themselves:
   

  

  

* Finance:
   

 Competitive salary package, share plan, company performance bonuses, value-based recognition awards, referral bonus;
* Career Development:
   

 Career coaching, global career opportunities, non-linear career paths, internal development programmes for management and technical leadership;
* Learning Opportunities:
   

 Complex projects, rotations, internal tech communities, training, certifications, coaching, online learning platforms subscriptions, pass-it-on sessions, workshops, conferences;
* Work-Life Balance:
   

 Hybrid work and flexible working hours, employee assistance programme;
* Health:
   

 Global internal wellbeing programme, access to wellbeing apps;
* Community:
   

 Global internal tech communities, hobby clubs and interest groups, inclusion and diversity programmes, events and celebrations.


 At Endava, we’re committed to creating an open, inclusive, and respectful environment where everyone feels safe, valued, and empowered to be their best. We welcome applications from people of all backgrounds, experiences, and perspectives—because we know that inclusive teams help us deliver smarter, more innovative solutions for our customers. Hiring decisions are based on merit, skills, qualifications, and potential. If you need adjustments or support during the recruitment process, please let us know.

title: Senior Software Engineer
description:
**Join our Team**
**About This Opportunity**
 Are you interested in being part of our digital success? Group IT is the trusted digital partner to Ericsson, creating insight, innovation and experience at the speed of our business. We maximize the value of data and technology to fuel the Digital Transformation of Ericsson. More on Group IT’s mission here or click on the link: https://bit.ly/35pxjmb
   

  

 We are growing and are looking for two experienced and ambitious Senior Software Engineers with drive and a passion for creating outstanding solutions! You will join a team that has a true agile mindset, innovation culture, fast pace and where you have opportunity to make an impact. In return, we expect you to have a deep motivation for your own personal development as well as sharing your knowledge and being active in creating a fun work environment.
   

  

**What You Will Do**
 You will work in a multicultural agile team with dedicated passionate colleagues to develop digital products using the latest technology and techniques. We put a lot of emphasis on continuous learning, innovation and expect you to actively contribute.
   

  

**The Skills You Bring**
* BSc/MSc level in Computer Science or the equivalent level of knowledge Minimum 5+ years of work experience
* Passion about learning and experimenting with modern technology platforms and software stacks
* Hands-on experience with frontend tools like React, TypeScript, Sass, Vitest, Vite, and Cypress, as well as backend technologies such as C#, .NET 8+, Entity Framework Core, xUnit, Moq, SQL Server, and Testcontainers
* Familiarity with cloud services and DevOps practices, including Azure (PaaS, FaaS), Azure DevOps, Infrastructure as Code (IaC), Git, GitHub, and enterprise DevOps workflows.
* Experience with software development fundamentals such as TDD, continuous integration/ continuous deployment, code reviews, source control, work item/issue tracking
* Experience with technical architecture standards, security and frameworks
* Experience in working in agile teams, collaborating with other teams and disciplines to deliver software from MVP phase to full scale
* Experience in designing and building cloud-native apps and cloud services that run at scale


 Experience in below is an advantage
   

  

* Skills in GUI and Ux development
* Knowledge of algorithms and data structures
* Experience in mentoring junior developers


**Why join Ericsson?**
 At Ericsson, you´ll have an outstanding opportunity. The chance to use your skills and imagination to push the boundaries of what´s possible. To build solutions never seen before to some of the world’s toughest problems. You´ll be challenged, but you won’t be alone. You´ll be joining a team of diverse innovators, all driven to go beyond the status quo to craft what comes next.
   

  

**Application**
 The positions can be based in Borås, Gothenburg or Stockholm. We are reviewing applications on a rolling basis, so we encourage you to apply as soon as possible. Kindly note that we do not accept applications sent via e-mail.
   

  

**What happens once you apply?**
 Click Here to find all you need to know about what our typical hiring process looks like.
   

  

 Encouraging a diverse and inclusive organization is core to our values at Ericsson, that's why we champion it in everything we do. We truly believe that by collaborating with people with different experiences we drive innovation, which is essential for our future growth. We encourage people from all backgrounds to apply and realize their full potential as part of our Ericsson team. Ericsson is proud to be an Equal Opportunity Employer. learn more.
   

  

**Primary country and city:** 
 Sweden (SE) || Borås
   

  

**Req ID:** 
 765284

title: Stockholms vassaste seniora utvecklare ServiceNow
company_industry: Software Development, IT Services and IT Consulting, and Business Consulting and Services
description:
**Jobbeskrivning**
**Om oss:**
 Sopra Steria är Europas ledande konsultföretag inom ServiceNow och digital transformation. Vi hjälper företag och organisationer att effektivisera sina verksamheter genom innovativa teknologilösningar. Med fler än 4000 ServiceNow-experter besitter vi marknadens största och mest framstående ServiceNow-team där du får möjligheten att arbeta med de mest spännande projekten samt utvecklas i en dynamisk och framåtlutad arbetsmiljö. Nu tar vi nästa stora kliv och satsar ännu hårdare på vår ledande position inom ServiceNow. Hos oss får du chansen att vara med och driva utvecklingen framåt, forma framtidens lösningar och göra verklig skillnad. Vill du vara en del av vårt ledande team?
   

  

**Om rollen:**
 I rollen som Senior Utvecklare inom ServiceNow kommer du att vara en nyckelspelare i att utveckla och implementera lösningar på ServiceNow-plattformen för våra kunder. Du säkerställer att tekniska lösningar håller hög kvalitet, är hållbara och anpassade efter kundens verksamhet. Som Elite Partner för ServiceNow har vi en av Skandinaviens största och mest kvalificerade konsultgrupper med närmare 500 dedikerade experter. Vi söker nu en erfaren Senior Utvecklare som kan ta en strategisk och operativ roll i våra teamleveranser.
   

  

**Dina huvudsakliga uppgifter:**
* Utveckla och konfigurera lösningar på ServiceNow-plattformen.
* Säkerställa teknisk kvalitet och bästa praxis i lösningarna.
* Fungera som rådgivare till kunder kring tekniska lösningar och plattformsutveckling.
* Leda tekniska workshops och kravinsamling med kunder.
* Samarbeta med processledare och andra roller för att säkerställa helhetslösningar.
* Analysera och optimera befintliga lösningar samt identifiera förbättringsområden.


**För att vara framgångsrik i rollen tror vi att du har:**
* Flerårig erfarenhet av utveckling och implementation inom ServiceNow.
* Gedigen kunskap i JavaScript samt god förståelse för webbteknologier som HTML och CSS.
* Erfarenhet av att arbeta med moduler som ITSM, ITOM, HR eller SecOps.
* Förmåga att leda tekniska dialoger och workshops med kund.
* Relevant akademisk utbildning inom IT eller motsvarande.
* Flytande svenska och engelska, både i tal och skrift.


**Vi erbjuder:**
* En spännande arbetsmiljö hos Europas ledande ServiceNow-konsultbolag.
* Möjlighet att arbeta med innovativa lösningar och den senaste tekniken.
* Kompetensutveckling genom certifieringar, utbildningar och mentorskap.
* Hybrid arbetsmodell samt konkurrenskraftiga villkor och förmåner.


**Om ServiceNow-teamet på Sopra Steria:**
 Sopra Steria är Nordens ledande expert inom ServiceNow – vi har den största och mest specialiserade kompetensen på marknaden. Vårt starka och sammansvetsade team levererar omfattande och högkvalitativa lösningar, där flera av våra erfarna ServiceNow-konsulter samarbetar för att maximera värdet för våra kunder. Vi drivs av innovation, samarbete och kunskapsutbyte – tillsammans sätter vi nya standarder och skapar framtidens digitala lösningar. Vill du arbeta med de bästa? Då är Sopra Steria platsen för dig.
   

  

**Om Sopra Steria:**
 Sopra Steria är en av Europas ledande aktörer inom digital transformation, med över 60 000 medarbetare i mer än 30 länder globalt. Vi driver innovation och hjälper företag och organisationer att effektivisera, utvecklas och skapa långsiktigt värde genom banbrytande teknologilösningar.
   

  

 Hos oss arbetar de främsta experterna inom sina områden i en dynamisk och framtidsorienterad miljö där samarbete, nytänkande och teknisk spetskompetens står i centrum.
   

  

**Vill du veta mer om oss? Läs här: Om oss | Sopra Steria**
**Ansökan:**
 Om du är redo att ta nästa steg i din karriär och vara en del av en framstående arbetsplats, ansök genom att ladda upp ditt CV. Kontakta gärna ansvarig rekryterare, Teodor Nellvik (teodor.nellvik@soprasteria.com) eller Business Owner Mikael Kroglund (mikael.kroglund@soprasteria.com) för eventuella frågor om tjänsten.
   

  

 På Sopra Steria ställer vi höga krav på både kompetens och säkerhetsmedvetenhet hos våra medarbetare. Innan en eventuell anställning kommer du därför att genomgå en bakgrundskontroll, och vid intervju behöver du kunna uppvisa giltig legitimation.
   

  

**Välkommen till Sopra Steria – där din kompetens formar framtidens digitala lösningar!**
**Ytterligare information**
 Sopra Steria är ett ledande internationellt konsultbolag inom digital transformation. Vi bygger samhället genom designdriven innovation, teknisk utveckling med kunskap om marknadens ledande plattformar och driftlösningar (managed services). Med modern teknologi och en gedigen affärsförståelse är vi en helhetspartner för våra kunder och deras digitala transformationsresa. Enligt Great Place To Work är vi en av Sveriges bästa arbetsplatser, vi har tilldelats utmärkelsen Karriärföretag flera år i rad och Gartner har listat oss som ett topp 5 bolag inom digital transformation.

title: SAP Developer
description:
Requirements -
 



  





 As a SAP S4HANA developer you will be responsible for the design, development, testing and support of ABAP objects being developed in S/4 HANA greenfield implementation project. A professional at this position level has the following responsibilities:
 


* Work closely with SAP functional consultant to deliver, maintain, troubleshoot and enhance SAP functionality.
* Builds professional relationships with team members and clients, to ensure delivery of proposed solutions.
* Good knowledge on any of the SAP Functional area eg; EAM, P2P, FICO, O2C, MM etc

* Good understanding on released API’s and best practices on building custom Fiori applications by using the Fiori elements templates.
* Experience working on BAS as well as Fiori Adaptation Project.Strong understanding of the UI principles
* Experience in Fiori Launchpad configuration
* Experience on OPD Forms

title: OneStream Developer
company_industry: IT Services and IT Consulting, Business Consulting and Services, and Professional Services
description:
**Who is the company and context?** 




 Our client is an international CFO advisory firm looking to strengthen their EPM practise in Stockholm. They are seeking an
 **OneStream Developer** 
 to play a key role in bridging the gap between business and IT departments at large corporations across various industries. This is a permanent position within an established consultancy where you will work on complex financial systems and process change projects.
 



  





**What will I be doing?** 



* Design and implement OneStream solutions for FP&A and Group Consolidation projects, bridging business and IT functions at major corporations
* Build complete models in OneStream and develop reporting systems from conception to delivery
* Collaborate with key stakeholders to understand finance problems, identify improvement opportunities, and create effective technical solutions



  





**What kind of skills and background will I need to have?** 



* Bachelor’s or master’s degree in Information Systems, Computer Science, Engineering, Business, Finance, Accounting, or related discipline
* Proficiently in C# and VB.net
* Knowledge of data integration and databases e.g. SQL and related database technologies
* Proficiency in leading EPM platforms such as OneStream, Oracle, SAP, Anaplan, Tagetik, Board, IBM Planning Analytics/TM1, Workiva, Workday Adaptive Planning, Lucanet, Prophix, or Pigment is essential
* Track record of delivering digital transformation projects
* Ability to engage with finance and business teams, translating requirements into technical solutions
* Understanding of finance processes (e.g., FP&A, accounting, consolidation)
* Fluent in English; Swedish language skills are a plus



  





**Why join this company?** 




 A great opportunity for someone who to join a company driving impactful digital finance transformations. You will have access to coaching, mentorship, and training opportunities in cutting edge technology solutions.
 



  





**How to apply?** 




 If this opportunity aligns with your experience and ambitions, or if you would like more information, please contact
 **Herman Hille-Dahl** 
 at
 **herman.hille-dahl@systemsaccountants.com** 




  





**Who are we?** 



* SystemsAccountants is a leading global financial systems, analytics, and transformation recruitment company. We provide permanent and contract solutions, helping organisations implement, support, develop, manage, and optimise EPM, ERP, and analytics systems. Our consultants operate internationally, ensuring both clients and candidates benefit from a global network and tailored expertise.

title: SAP Developer
description:
**Job Title:** 
 SAP S/4HANA Developer
 



**Location:** 
 Stockholm, Sweden
 



**Hybrid** 
 : 2-3 days per week on-site
 



**Type:** 
 Contract
 



**Duration** 
 : 6-12+ months with option to convert to permanent position
 



**Start Date:** 
 ASAP
 



**Hourly rate:** 
 300-500 SEK per hour (depending on the experience)
 



  





**Job Description:** 




 We are looking for an experienced SAP S/4HANA Developer to join our greenfield implementation project. In this role, you will design, develop, test, and support ABAP objects and collaborate closely with functional consultants to deliver high-quality SAP solutions.
 



  





**Key Responsibilities:** 



* Develop and support ABAP solutions in an S/4HANA environment.
* Work with functional teams to enhance SAP functionalities.
* Support the implementation of clean core and cloud-ready approaches.
* Build CDS Views, use the RAP framework, and develop with extensibility concepts.
* Work on RICEF objects, OData services, Fiori applications, and perform ABAP unit testing.



  





**Mandatory Skills:** 



* Strong ABAP skills with S/4HANA implementation experience.
* Experience with CDS Views, RAP, Key User and On-stack Extensibility.
* Knowledge of RICEF, Workflow, WebDynpro, ADT, Eclipse, SP Upgrades.
* Practical knowledge of Fiori Elements, BAS, and released SAP APIs.



  





**Nice to Have:** 



* Understanding of UI principles and Fiori Launchpad configuration.
* Experience with OPD Forms.



**Good functional knowledge in one or more SAP areas:** 
 EAM, P2P, FICO, O2C, MM, etc.

title: Lead Software Engineer in Quality Assurance
description:
****Do you want to be at the forefront of protecting our society against cyber threats? We are looking for a** 
**Lead** 
**Software** 
**Engineer** 
**focused on Quality Assurance** 
**to team up with the most dedicated team of cyber specialists in our Engineering Team.****
**About Truesec – A Leading Cybersecurity Company**
 Since 2005, Truesec has been a native cybersecurity company, driven by one single purpose: Creating safety and sustainability in a digital world by preventing cyber breach and minimizing impact.
   

  

 Over the years, we’ve earned the trust of organizations worldwide and gained a strong reputation internationally. Our team consists of dedicated specialists covering the entire spectrum of cybersecurity – with capabilities in Predict, Prevent, Protect, Respond, and Recover.
   

  

 Today, we employ around 300 employees – and as cybercrime grows, we need to grow. To support that goal, we are now looking for a Lead Software Engineer focused on Quality Assurance who wants to make a difference in our Truesec Engineering Team.
   

  

**Truesec Engineering Team**
 Truesec is the Nordic leader in cybersecurity and we’re on a journey to hyper-digitalize the way we prevent breaches and minimize impact from breach. Through a holistic digital experience based on our platform, we’re delivering global managed cybersecurity services. The Truesec engineering mission, enabling a digital Truesec and accelerating the enablement of Managed Services across domains.
   

  

**The role**
 We are looking for a Lead Software Engineer to join our team and play a key role in ensuring the delivery of high-quality software solutions across Truesec's platform and internal tools. This role focuses on designing, implementing, and maintaining robust testing frameworks and processes that ensure the reliability, performance, and security of both user-facing interfaces and backend systems. By collaborating with cross-functional teams, you will help deliver innovative solutions that meet both internal and external needs, supporting Truesec’s long-term goals and success.
   

  

**Responsibilities**
 As a Lead Software Engineer at Truesec, you will:
   

  

* Collaborate with cross-functional stakeholders (team members, architects, product managers, designers) to define testing strategies, plan deliverables, and align with agile development goals.
* Design and maintain test environments (e.g., test data generation, backend systems/APIs, CI/CD integration) and build automated testing frameworks for reliable code delivery.
* Implement and optimize end-to-end, performance, and load testing tools (e.g., XUnit, Vitest, Playwright) to validate frontend/backend systems and ensure platform scalability.
* Conduct testing, troubleshoot issues across the stack, and write clean, maintainable code while adhering to best practices and participating in code reviews.
* Document technical specifications, workflows, and architecture designs to promote collaboration and knowledge sharing, while staying updated on QA trends and mentoring team members.


**Experience And Qualifications**
 We are looking for candidates with the following skills and qualifications:
   

  

* Strong understanding of testing principles across frontend and backend systems (functional, integration, regression, performance, security testing) and proficiency with tools like Vitest, Playwright, XUnit, Postman, and performance/security testing frameworks.
* Skilled in frontend (React, TypeScript, JavaScript, HTML5, CSS3) and backend technologies (.NET, Python, database systems) with experience of integrating automated testing into CI/CD pipelines (GitHub Actions).
* Familiarity with Azure cloud technologies, Infrastructure as Code tools (Bicep), and best practices for clean, maintainable, and secure code.
* Ability to troubleshoot and debug across the stack, ensuring reliability, scalability, and security, complemented by strong analytical, problem-solving, and collaboration skills.
* Interest in continuous learning, staying updated on industry trends, and relevant educational background or equivalent practical experience.


***Due to the sensitivity in our assignments, we require Swedish citizenship, citizenship in an EU country, or a Swedish work permit.***
**Join Our Mission Toward a Safe Digital Future**
 If you truly want to make a difference and make our world a little bit safer, this is the place for you. At Truesec, you'll get to be at the forefront of fighting cybercrime instead of reading about it in the news. This is your chance to be part of an exciting journey in a leading cybersecurity company - and learn from some of the best in their field.
   

  

 So, are you ready to team up with the most dedicated team of experts and be part of a meaningful mission? Then we are excited to get to know you!

title: Release Test Engineer
description:
**Hej, Truecaller is calling you from Stockholm, Sweden! Ready to pick up?** 




  





 Our goal is to make communication smarter, safer, and more efficient, all while building trust everywhere. We're all about bringing you smart services with a big social impact, keeping you safe from fraud, harassment, scam calls or messages, so you can focus on the conversations that matter.
 



  




* Top 20 most downloaded apps globally, and world’s #1 caller ID and spam-blocking service for Android and iOS, with extensive AI capabilities, with more than
 **400 million** 
 active users per month.
* Founded in 2009, listed on Nasdaq OMX Stockholm and is categorized as a Large Cap. Our focus on innovation, operational excellence, sustainable growth, and collaboration has resulted in consistently high profitability and strong EBITDA margins.
* A team of 400 people from ~35 different nationalities spread across our headquarters in Stockholm and offices in Bangalore, Mumbai, Gurgaon and Tel Aviv
 **with high ambitions** 
 .



  





 We, the
 **Release team** 
 , manage app releases across platforms. We coordinate with external and internal stakeholders to ensure seamless releases are delivered every week. We also monitor the quality of these releases and report and escalate blockers. As part of the team, you will help implement and improve Release processes for planning, operations, and continuous improvements. You will be expected to coach, guide, and onboard people when it comes to release practices.
 



  





 As a Release Test Engineer, you will make sure that every step of the app release process is executed and that the results satisfy our release criteria. The steps include regression testing, risk analysis, coordination with Business units, cherry-picking of critical bugs as well as control and communication of features released. It also includes building new tools and enabling technologies to improve the Release process and enable other teams to deliver updates faster and more efficiently. You will be part of the Release team working and maintaining core processes at Truecaller.
 



  





**The impact you will create:** 




  




* Releasing the app across various platforms.
* Communicate and coordinate with Product and Engineering teams regarding releases every week.
* Drive cross-BU initiatives to enable or improve the Release Delivery process.
* Evaluate new modern tools and technologies to be integrated into the process.
* Maintain and improve CI pipelines.
* Onboarding of engineers to the release process.
* Develop and handle strategies for app releases.
* Create and document app release strategies and flows.
* Identify test activities and test dependencies that span across the backend and frontend domain to ensure end-to-end quality.
* Coordinate/coach the developer’s participation in the team's test activities.
* Monitor app vitals and issue escalations raised internally and externally.
* Automate test cases to ensure faster and more reliable regression coverage.
* Automate Release workflows.
* Be a gatekeeper for all team deliverables agreed quality levels to ensure that acceptance criteria and definition of done are met before a task is closed



  





**What you bring in:** 




  




* 3 to 7 years of relevant experience in Mobile app testing.
* Have a genuine passion for software quality and testing.
* Experience in testing in a medium or large-scale agile software development environment.
* Strong technical and troubleshooting skills.
* Familiarity with Data analysis, basic understanding of SQL, and handling data dashboards.
* Understanding and hands-on experience in UI test automation on mobile platforms, Android, iOS and Web automation.
* Experience with Android testing frameworks such as Espresso or Appium.
* Experience with Backend testing.
* Programming experience to be able to identify causes of problems in the code base and communicate efficiently with developers.
* Excellent manual testing skills.
* Experience with Issue & Project Tracking Software - JIRA.
* Experience with Android Studio and Xcode (optional).
* Experience in tools like Postman, Charles Proxy, or similar.
* Experience with Firebase Crashlytics.
* Experience with version controlling tools like Github etc and CI/CD tools like Github actions etc.



  





**It would be great if you also have:** 




  




* Experience working in a Startup.
* Programming experience to be able to identify the causes of problems in the code base and communicate efficiently with developers.
* Building and maintaining automation frameworks from scratch.
* Experience in efficient communication with various stakeholders like POs, PMs, QAs, etc
* Experience with working in multi-cultural and distributed environments.
* Experience with handling customer support issues.
* Experience in web platform testing is good to have.



  





 Life at Truecaller - Behind the code: https://www.instagram.com/lifeattruecaller/
 



 Sounds like your dream job?
 



  





 We will fill the position as soon as we find the right candidate, so please send your application as soon as possible. As part of the recruitment process, we will conduct a background check.
 



 This position is based in Stockholm, Sweden.
 



 We only accept applications in English.
 



  





**What we offer:** 




  




* **A smart, talented, and agile team** 
 : An international team where ~35 nationalities are working together in several locations and time zones with a learning, sharing, and fun environment.
* **A great compensation package:** 
 Competitive salary, 30 days of paid vacation, flexible working hours, private health insurance, parental leave top-up, pension contribution, Udemy membership to keep learning and improving, and free gym membership.
* **Great tech tools:** 
 Pick the computer and phone you most fancy within our budget ranges.
* **Office life:** 
 We strongly believe in in-person collaboration and follow an office-first approach while offering some flexibility. Enjoy your days with great colleagues with loads of good stuff to learn from, and a wide range of yummy snacks and beverages. In addition, every now and then check out the playroom for a fun break or join our exciting parties and or team activities such as Lab days, Running team, movie nights in our cinema, or a Geek lunch. There’s something for everyone!



  





**Come as you are:** 




  





 Truecaller is diverse, equal, and inclusive. We need a variety of backgrounds, perspectives, beliefs, and experiences to keep building our great products. No matter where you are based, which language you speak, your accent, race, religion, color, nationality, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, etc. All those things make you who you are, and that’s why we would love to meet you.

title: Machine Learning Engineer
description:
**Avigna is hiring Machine Learning Engineer**
 Our IT Delivery Center aims to build strong and sustainable solutions for customers across Europe. We are looking for a
 **Machine Learning Engineer** 
 to join the team to build, support, and drive customer innovations, bringing efficiency to the processes through effective management of cost and schedule.
   

  

 In alignment with Avigna’s values, we are committed to providing an inclusive work environment for all employees to positively impact our culture every day.
   

  

**Experience**
* 4+ years of professional experience working in relevant roles as a Machine Learning Engineer
* Strong coding experience in modern programming languages, especially Python (3+ years)
* Experience developing software products successfully deployed to production
* Hands-on experience with cloud technologies for ML development (Google Cloud, Vertex AI preferred)
* Strong background in MLOps practices, ML pipeline development, and production deployment of ML applications
* Deep understanding of AI/ML techniques and familiarity with various frameworks
* Expertise in handling high-volume heterogeneous data (batch and stream) and solid knowledge of data structures, databases, and data storage technologies


**Location:**
* Stockholm, Sweden


**Mode Of Work**
* Onsite (Remote work not allowed)


**Assignment Period**
* 26 May 2025 to 31 Oct 2025


**Responsibilities**
* Develop AI/ML software products, including exploring large datasets, testing new algorithms, and optimizing model outputs
* Design, develop, and maintain large-scale data infrastructure for AI/ML projects
* Apply software architecture principles and design patterns to create scalable, maintainable, well-structured solutions
* Develop frameworks and components addressing common AI/ML needs, such as feature reuse, model traceability, and A/B testing

**Qualification**
* BSc or MSc in Computer Science, Engineering, or a related field (or equivalent practical experience)

**What We Offer**

 AVIGNA holds Service authorization for SAP S/4 HANA and SAP Business All in one.
   

  

 We have received an
 **SAP Recognized Expertise designation for SAP® S/4HANA.** 
 We have consultants serving various customers using SAP and non-SAP products. Our Consulting experience spans across Telecom, Retail, Electrical, Paper, and Social Service Industries.

title: SAP Fiori Developer
description:

 **SAP Fiori Developer** 
 to join a high-profile S/4HANA greenfield implementation project. This role involves end-to-end ownership of Fiori/UI5 development, including design, enhancement, extensibility, and support in line with clean core principles.
